name: Disable Native Image Compression
author: Nithin Jawahar

sections.description:
In WordPress 5.3, When an image is uploaded that exceeds the 2560px, a new “full” size image is generated. This image is compressed and used instead of the true original image.

This plugin disables the image threshold and keeps the originally uploaded image as the full size.
sections.installation:
1. Upload this plugin to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.faq: This plugin was just released, so there are no questions that have been asked frequently yet!

short_description: Disables the Image Compression introduced by wordpress in WordPress 5.3.
description:
In WordPress 5.3, When an image is uploaded that exceeds the 2560px, a new “full” size image is generated. This image is compressed and used instead of the true original image.

This plugin disables the image threshold and keeps the originally uploaded image as the full size.
